main event: A radar detection of an unidentified object moving rapidly and erratically over Columbus, Ohio in the early hours of November 4, 1957.
interesting points: The object was seen on radar scope for about 4 minutes., The object made several fast and erratic movements at high speed in various directions., Another sighting recorded on November 15, 1957 described a star-shaped object moving slowly in the sky for 10 minutes., The later sighting was determined to be likely Venus., Both sightings involved a single object being tracked.
witness description: RADAR observation only, no visual confirmation.
